Description: Scarab carved from steatite; rather stylised back with clypeus simply indicated, elytra and prothorax marked by single incised lines; side view unknown; underside roughly incised with hieroglyphic inscription arranged vertically, surmounted by a winged sun and above neb-basket sign; pierced lengthwise; in beige steatite with bluish tinge on surface; modern glue on back.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Scarab Factory (according to museum register)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The association of the throne name of Thutmose III (“Menkheperra”) with the epithet "image of Amun" or "of Amun-Ra" on scarabs is very common. As stated by Hornung and Staehelin (Hornung and Staehelin 1976, 240, Pl. 24 no. 249), it comes in different arrangements and with various additional elements (see for example: Hall 1913, no. 705-753; Rowe 1936, pl. XII nos. 487 and 496; Matouk 1971, S. 213 no. 453-455; Jaeger 1982, fig. 194). Such composition was most likely used well after the reign of Thutmose III (Jaeger 1982, § 1090; specimen with winged sun no. 26 dated between 19th and 25th dynasty). See also two scarabs with a similar formula dated to the 25th dynasty: Magnarini 2004, 395-6, nos 11.51-2. Since the Museum register mentions that it was found in the Scarab Factory, a 26th Dynasty date could be a possibility. However, the Scarab Factory is a findspot that has been reported for scarabs and scaraboids of a secure earlier date. Jaeger, B. 1982. Essai de classification et datation des scarabées Menkhéperrê, Fribourg. Hall, H.R. 1913, Catalogue of Egyptian Scarabs, etc., in the British Museum, Vol. I Royal Scarabs, London. Hornung, E. and Staehelin, E. 1976, Skarabäen und andere Siegelamulette aus Basler Sammlungen, Ägyptische Denkmäler in der Schweiz I. Matouk, F.S. 1971, Corpus du scarabée égyptien. T. I: Les scarabées royaux, Beirut. Rowe, A. 1936, A Catalogue of Egyptian Scarabs, Scaraboids, Seals and Amulets in the Palestine Archaeological Museum, Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.55) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
